info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 22 at 6:59PM MDT until July 22 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 659 PM MDT, A dangerous flooding situation is setting up for the southern Mesilla Valley.
Radar indicates 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen around Berino, especially east of state highway 28. Rainfall amounts taper off to around 1 inch closer to Chamberino. Heavy rain has shifted north and east of the area, but runoff is likely still affecting arroyos coming off the east mesa.Flas
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Anthony, Berino and Chamberino.
Flood reports are beginning to come in, including a closure on I-10 near Vado due to flooding.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DONA ANA COUNTY
